org.phoenixbioinformatics.proxy.controller
Class LoggerManager

java.lang.Object
  org.phoenixbioinformatics.proxy.controller.LoggerManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, javax.servlet.ServletContextListener
public class LoggerManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements javax.servlet.ServletContextListener

The Visit Logger is a static context listener that asynchronously logs all requests that come into the proxy server to the Paywall database. The proxy servlet enqueues the information to log, and the VisitLogger thread asynchronously writes the log entry to the database.

Author:
Robert J. Muller

log

public static void log(java.lang.String ipAddress,
                       java.lang.String url,
                       java.lang.String sessionId,
                       java.math.BigInteger loginId,
                       java.lang.String status)
Log a URL request from an IP address. Optionally log the community id if the user is logged in. Specify the status of the proxy request (Proxied, Refused, Metered). If there is no session, the method does nothing as the session information is required for persistent logging.

Parameters:
ipAddress - the IP address (V4, quad format)
url - the URL, including parameters
sessionId - the session id for the Http Session
loginId - the TAIR community id for the logged in user or null if not logged in
status - Proxied, Refused, Metered--the resolution status of the request
